近所の皆様から|苦情が入っちゃってね♪=We've been receiving complaints from one of the local neighborhoods♪
最近の風潮からすると|そういうのって無視|できないのよね～ん♪=Let's just say they caught a whiff of what's going on and can no longer ignore it♪#There is a pun in this line with the word 風潮. Broken into separate parts it means wind + current, but together they can mean trend/ tendency. He's saying "Due to recent trends..." but the joke is that the smell of the dissections is travelling on the wind.

聞かなくてもわかるでしょ・・・=I imagine you can figure that out on your own...

なんで　みんな|パティの異常さに気がつかねェんだ？=Why doesn't anybody notice how strange Patty is?
シラサギの中にカラスが|まじってるくらい　おかしいのに|気にも止めねェ・・・=She's so weird she draws zebras without their stripes. And yet nobody even bats an eye...#Here Soul is saying Patty combines herons/egrets and crows as an example of her strangeness. I couldn't find any cultural significance behind these two birds specifically that would make the combination strange. I'm inclined to believe it's simply because one is white and the other is black. That being said, herons/egrets are generally seen positively and crows can sometimes be seen negatively, especially in modern times due to the problems they cause in larger cities throughout Japan. There are also crow tengu within the Japanese folklore, which may add to them being seen in a more negative light, but they are also traditionally a symbol of divine intervention, rebirth, etc.
たしかに死武専は異常な所だけどよ・・・=The DWMA is definitely a weird place, but...
パティのそれは|そういうものとは|根本的に違うんだよな・・・=Patty takes it to a whole other level entirely...
とにかく考えててもしょうがねェ・・・|パティの身辺を洗うことにしよう・・・=Well, just thinking about it isn't going to get me anywhere... Let's see if there isn't any dirt I can dig up on Patty...

The original Japanese is "Um... Are you two... still not finished?" The original Japanese is supposed to be funny, but I think it falls a little flat in English, especially without an English voiceover.

That boy isn't star caliber just yet.#トメ is the abrupt stop at the end of a kanji stroke, and similarly, ハネ is the hook ending on vertical strokes. Literally the sentence says something along the lines of 'It can be seen that he hesitates between 'tome' and 'hane', but obviously that won't make any sense to the majority of people. Hence the comment about his bad handwriting.
『マカのアルバム』だね|他人の家庭の事情だからねぇ|ノーコメントにさせてもらうよ=It's Maka's Album. I'll keep my comments to myself. These are private family matters, after all.

『ヒゲグサ』だね|紳士のおヒゲのような形をした植物だよ|博士はこれを材料にまた怪しい薬を・・・=It's a Whiskeroot. It's a plant that resembles a mustache. What on earth does the professor need this for...?

『ダブルムーンの花』だね|薬の材料だって　あの保健医は言うけどね|どうもおばちゃんには信じられないよ・・・=It's a Gemooni Flower. That doctor says it just a medicinal ingredient, but Auntie doesn't believe her one bit...
『アメリカつばき』だね|繁殖力が低いから滅多に見つからないんだよ|ザリガニとは正反対だね・・・=It's an American Camellia. You won't come across one often since they're not very fertile. Unlike wild rabbits...#ザリガニ is a crayfish. I had to do some research, but since the start of the 20th century, the crayfish native to Japan have been in decline, due in part to the introduction of American crayfish to the ecosystem. Japanese crayfish are now considered an endangered species. I figured no one would understand the comparison to crayfish, so I mention rabbits that are pretty universally known in the western world for their high fertility.
『暗殺奥義書』だね|星族の暗殺奥義が書かれてる危険な本だよ|・・・全部始末したと思ってたんだけどね=It's a Book of Secret Assassinations. It speaks of the secrets of the Star Clan. I thought they were all destroyed.
『エクスカリバー人形』だね|見てるだけでも人をイライラさせる人形だよ|おばちゃんも　だんだんイライラしてきたね=It's an Excalibur Doll. Just looking at it can put someone on edge. Even Auntie is starting to get a little annoyed.
『魂の実』だね|美味しい木の実・・・それだけだよ・・・|形は何かを期待させるんだけどね・・・=It's a Soul Seed. Just a tasty nut... That's all... The shape does make you expect something more though.
『デスキャンドル』だね|永遠に灯り続ける珍しいろうそくだよ|よく盗まれるから困ってるんだよ=It's a Death Candle. A rare candle that burns for an eternity. Kind of a pain since they get stolen so often.
『血の宝石』だね|月から落ちてくると伝えられる石だよ|校門のツノを修理するのに必要なんだよ=It's a Blood Bijou. It's said that they fall from the moon. They're necessary to repair the horns at the school gate.

『呪い人形？』だね|夜になると勝手に動き出すって噂だよ|気味が悪いってあちこちに捨てられてるよ=It's a Cursed Doll? Rumor has it that they move about on their own at night. These creeps turn up everywhere.

設定したい項目にポインターを|合わせて　Aボタンを押せば|設定を変更することができます=Hover the pointer over the settings you wish to configure and press the|A button.
サウンド出力のモノラル/ステレオを|設定します=Set the audio output to Mono/Stereo.
メッセージと同時に再生されるボイスの|オフ/オンを設定します　メッセージのない|ボイスやムービーには適用されません=Set the message voice playback to On/Off. Does not apply to cutscenes and speech without text.
メッセージ送りの自動オフ/自動オンを|設定します　一部のメッセージには|自動オフが適用されません=Set the text autoplay to Off/On. Certain text autoplay cannot be disabled.

Wii本体保存メモリの空き容量が|不足しています。データを保存する場合は|「Wiiメニューのデータ管理画面に戻る」|を選択し、セーブデータ画面でデータを|SDカードに移動するか、データを消去して|１ブロックの空き容量を確保してください。=Insufficient free space in Wii system memory. First, select 'Return to Wii Data Management Screen'. Then from the save data screen, delete or transfer data to an SD card to secure a block of free space.
Wii本体保存メモリの空きファイル数が|不足しています。データを保存する場合は|「Wiiメニューのデータ管理画面に戻る」|を選択し、セーブデータ画面でデータを|SDカードに移動するか、データを|消去してください。=Insufficient empty files in Wii system memory. To save, first select 'Return to Wii Data Management Screen'. Then from the save data screen, delete or transfer data to an SD card.
Wii本体保存メモリの|空き容量が異常です。|くわしくはWii本体の取扱説明書を|お読みください。=Abnormal free space in Wii system memory. For more details, please refer to the Wii Operations Manual.
Wii本体保存メモリの|空きファイル数が異常です。|くわしくはWii本体の取扱説明書を|お読みください。=Abnormal number of empty files in Wii system memory. For more details, please refer to the Wii Operations Manual.
データが壊れているため、|このファイルは使用できません。|「セーブデータを削除する」を選択し、|壊れたデータを消去してください。=This data is corrupted and cannot be used. Select 'Delete Save Data' to remove the corrupted data.
Wii本体保存メモリが壊れました。|くわしくはWii本体の取扱説明書を|お読みください。=Wii system memory corrupted. For more details, please refer to the Wii Operations Manual.
Wii本体保存メモリの|書き込み/読み出し中にエラーが|発生しました。|くわしくはWii本体の取扱説明書を|お読みください。=An error occurred while accessing Wii system memory. For more details, please refer to the Wii Operations Manual.

コマンドボタンを使えば|技の出し方が見れるわ=You can review how to use techniques with the Command button.
コマンドボタンを使えば|技の出し方が見れるよ=You can review how to use techniques with the Command button.
２連続攻撃|Ａボタンを連続して２回押します=2-hit Combo: Press the A button 2 times in succession.
４連続攻撃|Ａボタンを連続して４回押します=4-hit Combo: Press the A button 4 times in succession.
派生４連続攻撃|２連続攻撃のあと　Ａボタンを押しながら|リモコンを振り　続けてＡボタンを押します=Alternate 4-hit Combo: After two hits, hold the A button, shake the Wiimote continuously, and press A again.
６連続攻撃|Ａボタンを連続して６回押します=6-hit Combo: Press the A button 6 times in succession.
派生６連続攻撃|４連続攻撃のあと　Ａボタンを押しながら|リモコンを振り　続けてＡボタンを押します=Alternate ６-hit Combo: After four hits, hold the A button, shake the Wiimote continuously, and press A again.
９連続攻撃|Ａボタンを連続して９回押します=9-hit Combo: Press the A button 9 times in succession.
派生８連続攻撃|６連続攻撃のあと　Ａボタンを押しながら|リモコンを振り　続けてＡボタンを押します=Alternate 8-hit Combo: After six hits, hold the A button, shake the Wiimote continuously, and press A again.

この連続技はＬｖが３になることで|使えるようになります=This combo technique is unlocked at Lv. 3.
この連続技はＬｖが６になることで|使えるようになります=This combo technique is unlocked at Lv. 6.
この連続技はＬｖが９になることで|使えるようになります=This combo technique is unlocked at Lv. 9.
この連続技はＬｖが１２になることで|使えるようになります=This combo technique is unlocked at Lv. 12.
必殺技ゲージが１つ以上あるときに|Ｃボタンを押して　この必殺技を選び|指示されたとおりにリモコンを操作します=When you have at least one Soul Resonance Gauge, press C, pick this skill, and move the Wiimote as shown.#must be kept short
必殺技ゲージが２つ以上あるときに|Ｃボタンを押して　この必殺技を選び|指示されたとおりにリモコンを操作します=When you have at least two Soul Resonance Gauges, press C, pick this skill, and move the Wiimote as shown.
